bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from J. L. Farnum to Laura Armistead Carter, April 21, 1928

div1.p: In response to her request, Farnum sends Carter a library card permitting her access to areas of the stacks of the Library of Congress that will be of assistance in her work.

div1.head: Letter from J. L. Farnum to Laura Armistead Carter, April 21, 1928
div1.opener:
Book
Library of Congress
LIBRARY OF CONGRESS
WASHINGTON
F-AP
OFFICE OF THE LIBRARIAN
April 21 1928
Dear Madam:
div1.p:
In response to your request of this morn-
ing, I am sending herewith, by direction of the Libra-
rian, a card permitting you access to the stacks con-
taining works on medicine, yellow fever subjects, travel,
exploration, history and allied subjects, until December
31, 1928.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, J. L. Farnum Secretary
(1 enclosure)
Miss Laura Armistead Carter
The Westmoreland
2122 California Street N. W.
Washington D. C.
